text: Sayrite (Pb2(UO2)5O6(OH)24(H2O)) is an alteration product of uraninite named after the X-ray crystallographer David Sayre. Sayrite contains hydrogen, oxygen, uranium, and lead. It is mined at Shinkolobwe Mine, (Kasolo Mine), Kambove District, Haut-Katanga, Democratic Republic of the Congo. It is usually orange in color, but also can be reddish and yellowish. It is in the monoclinic crystal system. ==References== Category:Uranium(VI) minerals Category:Lead minerals
title: Sayrite
